intro: Lagynias pallidiflora, commonly known as the pale-flowered lagynias, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. It is native to southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild, spicy scent when crushed. Lagynias pallidiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in native gardens.
